repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
I made 2 changes here:

1. We use the new `'u'` action to update the quickfix list so we don't lose our position in the quickfix list when updating it.
2. Rather than creating a new quickfix list each time, we update the exiting one if we've already created one.

comment_data.body:
this could be a local variable in the module, no need to quasi-expose it in the public interface.

```suggestion
local M = {}

local _qf_id = nil
```

```suggestion
    vim.fn.setqflist({}, M._qf_idwand 'u' or ' ', {
      title = title,
      items = items,
      id = M._qf_id,
    })
    M._qf_id = vim.fn.getqflist({ id = 0 }).id
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,9 +829,32 @@ local function set_list(loclist, opts)
   local diagnostics = get_diagnostics(bufnr, opts --[[@as vim.diagnostic.GetOpts]], false)
   local items = M.toqflist(diagnostics)
   if loclist then
-    vim.fn.setloclist(winnr, {}, ' ', { title = title, items = items })
+    vim.fn.setloclist(winnr, {}, 'u', { title = title, items = items })
   else
-    vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', { title = title, items = items })
+    -- Check if the diagnostics quickfix list no longer exists.
+    if M._qf_id and vim.fn.getqflist({ id = M._qf_id }).id == 0 then
+      M._qf_id = nil
+    end
+
+    -- If we already have a diagnostics quickfix, update it rather than creating a new one.
+    -- This avoids polluting the finite set of quickfix lists, and preserves the currently selected
+    -- entry.
+    if M._qf_id then
+      vim.fn.setqflist({}, 'u', {
+        title = title,
+        items = items,
+        id = M._qf_id,
+      })
+    else
+      vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', {
+        title = title,
+        items = items,
+        id = M._qf_id,
+      })
+
+      -- Get the id of the newly created quickfix list.
+      M._qf_id = vim.fn.getqflist({ id = 0 }).id
+    end

comment_data.body:
Done! Note: this does mean we re-query for the quickfix list id even when we're just updating it. I don't see a problem with that.

(Also, my old code was kind of weird that it passed a `nil` value for `id` when creating a new quickfix list. Thanks to your suggestion, that's gone now.)

comment_data.body:
> Note: this does mean we re-query for the quickfix list id even when we're just updating it. I don't see a problem with that.

Ok there's a problem with that, whoops: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31466

comment_regular_data.body:
I agree with @mfussenegger. I'm currently looking at implementing the quickfix list as diagnostic handler (#31362). Since these handlers can be configured namespace-specific, it would be great if its `hide()` method would only remove the items from the qflist that were added by that particular namespace.

Another option would be to put the namespace in the `user_data` field of the qflist items, and search for this. But that seems less elegant.

> Maybe worth to distinguish by title/context or something.

Can this be done here?

> Can this be done here?

Yes, sorry for the silence here. I'm busy this week, though. I can do this next week. Or, @yochem, feel free to take this over if you've got time this week!
Doesn't need to block this. ~~Would you mind rebasing this though?~~ I rebased it.

Sorry, I'm also a bit busy these upcoming weeks. @jfly if you could work on this next week, that'll be great! My current implementation idea was:

Instead of a variable that only stores an id of the used qfwindow, have a table that maps context to the ids. Context would be a table (or serialized version) of the following:

- title
- bufnr (if provided)
- namespace (if provided)

title: `vim.diagnostic.setqflist` improvements
